title: Mixed atonement and dedicatory birds
vignette: A woman's obligatory atonement bird offering becomes mixed with her dedicatory bird offering before the community elder can designate which is which.

options.text: Offer all birds as dedicatory offerings, bringing a new pair for the obligation.
Split them: one as atonement offering, one as dedicatory offering regardless of uncertainty.

title: Two women's pairs of birds combined
vignette: Bird gifts from two different women accidentally get mixed together at the central assembly place.

options.text: Allocate one atonement and one dedicatory bird for each woman.
Require both women to bring entirely new offerings.

title: One bird escapes
vignette: From a designated pair, a single bird flies away before offering.

options.text: Replace only the missing bird and proceed.
Bring a whole new pair to avoid doubt.

title: Purchased pair of birds without specifying
vignette: A donor buys two birds but forgets which was meant for atonement offering and which for dedicatory offering.

options.text: Designate them now and continue.
Purchase a fresh pair with clear intent.

title: Exchanged birds between pairs of birds
vignette: Community elders accidentally swap one bird from each of two pairs of birds during preparation.

options.text: Offer each mixed pair as is, relying on majority.
Invalidate both pairs and start over.

title: Voluntary birds mixed with obligatory
vignette: A pledged bird offering falls into a cage of obligatory birds for childbirth.

options.text: Count one bird as the pledged offering and proceed.
Discard the entire group and bring new offerings.

title: Community Elder mislabels offerings
vignette: The community elder calls out the wrong designation when ritually prepares a bird.

options.text: The bird is invalid and must be replaced.
Correct the intent mid-process and continue.

title: Majority unknown in a large mix
vignette: Many birds from various women mix together so that obligatory and voluntary offerings are indistinguishable.

options.text: Treat all as voluntary dedicatory offerings and request new obligatory pairs.
Randomly assign atonement and dedicatory birds until numbers match.

title: Dead bird among the group
vignette: One bird in a designated pair dies before being offered.

options.text: Replace the dead bird only.
Replace the entire pair to maintain consistency.

title: Doubt if pair was already offered
vignette: A woman isn't sure whether her birds were already offered or not.

options.text: Bring another pair to remove any doubt.
Assume they were offered and bring nothing.

title: Bird fell into another pair of birds and returned
vignette: A bird briefly escapes and then returns; the owner is uncertain if it is the same bird.

options.text: Accept it as the original and proceed.
Replace it to avoid any mix-up.

title: Two pairs merged then separated
vignette: Pairs from two different offerings merge in a cage, then the birds are separated again but not sure who is whose.

options.text: Assign randomly and proceed.
Consider all birds doubtful and require new pairs.

title: Overpayment for a pair of birds
vignette: A woman pays extra for her birds expecting premium quality, but receives ordinary doves.

options.text: Accept the birds; quality doesn't affect validity.
Demand replacement birds matching the price paid.

title: Switching species
vignette: Turtledoves and pigeons are both acceptable but have different age requirements. The offerings get swapped.

options.text: Offer as is since both species are allowed.
Replace to match the original species intended.

title: Excess birds purchased
vignette: A donor accidentally buys an extra pair of birds beyond what is needed.

options.text: Offer the extras as voluntary dedicatory offerings.
Sell them back and keep only the required offerings.
